availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Greenup County Court
March Term 1864
Present Hon. John Seaton
Presiding Judge
Joseph B. Puthuff a Justice of the Peace in District No 1 in this County, having departed this life, this Court doth recommend Clem Swearingen as a proper person to supply the vacancy.
A. Copy Attest Wm Corum clerk

We the undersigned would respectfully petition His Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky to appoint and commission Clem Swearingen a Justice of the peace for district No 1 in Greenup County in place of J. B. Puthuff deceased late Justice

James Morton
Wm C Ireland
Cyrus Vanbibber Sr
James H. Morgan
O. Van Bibber
A. VanBibber
A. L. Reed
Benja Smith
S. Polluck
B F Prutt
Ed F. Dulin
L. D. Ross

Greenup Co
J. P.
apptd
21st Mch/64
